member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery
member.summary: The Blazor Media Query component allows developers to create responsive layouts. The component tracks changes in the browser size and notifies when the browser size matches the specified media query. The class is used to store information about each media query breakpoint, including the Breakpoint name and the MediaQuery itself. The property returns the Breakpoint of the MediaBreakpoint in the MediaBreakpoints collection that matches the current browser size. This allows developers to easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Small
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined media query ((max-width: 768px) for Small break point. If is not specified, this default media query will be used by .

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Medium
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined media query ((min-width: 768px) for Medium break point. If is not specified, this default media query will be used by .

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Large
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined media query ((min-width: 1024px) for Large break point. If is not specified, this default media query will be used by .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.ActiveBreakpoint
member.summary: Gets the of the in collection that matches with the current browser size. Based on the ActiveBreakpoint, developers can easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types.
member.value: A string value that represents the of the in collection that matches with the browser size. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of that contains the and . is set when a matches with the current browser size from this collection.
member.value: A collection of that contains the and . The defaul value is empty collection.
member.remarks: If is not specified, will use built-in collection of that contains , and media queries.

member.summary: Gets or sets the event that is triggered when the is changed.
member.value: An event that is triggered when the is changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the event that is triggered when the is changed.
member.value: An event that is triggered when the is changed.

member.summary: A method that is used to update the which is invoked from interop.

member.summary: A method that is used to update collection

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.UpdateActiveBreakpointChanged(System.String)
member.summary: A method that is used to update the .

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint
member.summary: A class that used to define break point and media query for component. The MediaBreakpoint class has two main properties: Breakpoint and MediaQuery. The Breakpoint property is a string that specifies the name of the breakpoint and the MediaQuery property is a string that specifies the media query associated with the breakpoint, which determines when the responsive layout changes associated with the breakpoint should be applied.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the break point.
member.value: A string value that represents the name of the break point.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets the media query.
member.value: A string value that represents the media query.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BreakpointChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about the event callback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BreakpointChangedEventArgs.ActiveBreakpoint
member.summary: Gets the active breakpoint.
member.value: A of the in collection that matches with the current browser size.

member.summary: Returns the property value of a specified object of any type includes static types, and types.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfBaseComponent
member.summary: A Base Component for all the Syncfusion Blazor UI components to implement the common functionalities.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfBaseComponent.showLicenseComponent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show component on rendering this component. The default value is false and it will be set to true right before init the component. So, OnAfterRender will get called for SyncfusionLicense component in all use cases.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfBaseComponent.PropertyChanges
member.summary: A dictionary maintains changes properties names and value. Based on the count, you can refresh UI in OnParametersSetAsync. This dictionary will be cleared in .
member.remarks: Changes properties should be added in OnParametersSetAsync by calling .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfBaseComponent.PrevChanges
member.summary: While update the two way binding property value in set method the component change event call repeatedly, so that we have add the value this dictionary and restrict based on this value.

member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfBaseComponent.OnAfterRenderAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method invoked after each time the component has been rendered.
member.param: Set to true for the first time component rendering; otherwise gets false.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.SyncfusionBlazorService.IsDevice
member.summary: Returns true when the application is running on a mobile or IPad device. This method should be called only in the OnAfterRenderAsync life cycle method.
member.returns: Returns true, if the application rendering in mobile or IPad devices.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.SyncfusionBlazorService.UpdateSyncfusionService(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the device mode property and import the components interop scripts when IgnoreScriptIsolation is false.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.SyncfusionBlazorService.SetIsDevice(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method invokable by JS to update the device mode and initialize components interop scripts importing after the init script is loaded on the web page when IgnoreScriptIsolation is false.
member.param: Boolean value to identify whether the application is rendering in mobile or IPad devices.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions
member.summary: A class that provides options to configure global settings for our Syncfusion Blazor components.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.IgnoreScriptIsolation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Syncfusion Blazor scripts are loaded internally using JavaScript Isolation or refer to the required scripts from the application-end for better performance.
member.value: true, if the scripts should be referenced externally in the application-end from NuGet or CDN or by generating from CRG. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When the property value is false, the Blazor scripts are loaded from built-in source using JavaScript Isolation internally.
member.example:
You can add script reference in one of the following ways externally for better performance when IgnoreScriptIsolation is true.
Reference scripts from NuGet To add script reference for all component except PdfViewer and DocumentEditor.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor/scripts/syncfusion-blazor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for PdfViewer.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor.PdfViewer/scripts/syncfusion-blazor-pdfviewer.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for DocumentEditor.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor.WordProcessor/scripts/syncfusion-blazor-documenteditor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
Reference scripts from CDN To add script reference for all component except PdfViewer and DocumentEditor.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for PdfViewer.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor-pdfviewer.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for DocumentEditor.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor-documenteditor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
Note: Ensure to change the version in CDN link based on the syncfusion version you are using.
Reference scripts by generating from Blazor CRG for only used components Generate a required component script and styles from Blazor custom resource generator(Blazor CRG) and refer to them in your application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.EnableRippleEffect
member.summary: Specifies whether the ripple effect is enabled in the application.
member.value: true, if the ripple effect is enabled in the application. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.EnableRtl
member.summary: Specifies whether the Rtl mode enabled in the application.
member.value: true, if the Rtl mode enabled in the application. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.Animation
member.summary: Gets or sets global options to control animation behaviors for animation supported Syncfusion Blazor components.
member.value: Default, if the animation works in all the Syncfusion Blazor components based on its animation property value. Enable/Disable, to control the animation in all the Syncfusion Blazor components. The default value is 'Default'.
member.remarks: Control the animation globally in all Syncfusion Blazor components. By default, the animation works based on the individual component's animation property value. But the animation is enabled or disabled globally in all Syncfusion Blazor components by configure this GlobalOptions property as Enable/Disable. For example, If GlobalOptions.Animation is Enable and Blazor Chart animation is false, the animation applies to the Blazor Chart component. If GlobalOptions.Animation is Disable and Blazor Chart animation is true, the animation doesn't applies to the Chart component.
